summary: The diff implements most of the required features: public website pages (Home, About, Services, Blog, Contact), admin panel with login, inquiry management, blog post management, services management, and a premium visual theme. However, the admin credential storage security is questionable — the backend stores what appears to be a hardcoded hash string as a Motoko let constant rather than using a proper hashing function at runtime. A 'Clear All' inquiries bulk-delete feature was also added without being requested, as were a WhatsApp floating button and individual blog post detail pages.

missing_requirements.requirement: Admin credentials must be stored securely in the backend — hashed, never in plaintext
missing_requirements.reason: In backend/main.mo, adminPasswordHash is stored as a plain Motoko string literal. There is no evidence of a proper hashing function being applied at runtime; the value is a hardcoded constant. The comment explicitly says 'Passwords are not needed in the backend as authorized users have already entered correct passwords', suggesting password verification logic may not be properly implemented with secure hashing.

hallucinated_features.description: Bulk 'Clear All' inquiries feature in the admin panel
hallucinated_features.reason: The InquiriesManagement page includes a 'Clear All' button that deletes all inquiries at once via a useClearInquiries mutation. REQ-3 only asks for deleting individual inquiries.

hallucinated_features.description: WhatsApp floating action button on all public pages
hallucinated_features.reason: A sticky WhatsApp button was added to the public layout on all pages. This feature was not requested in any requirement.

hallucinated_features.description: Individual blog post detail page at /blog/$id
hallucinated_features.reason: A BlogPost.tsx page and corresponding route /blog/$id was implemented allowing navigation to full blog post content. No requirement asked for individual blog post detail pages — REQ-1 and REQ-4 only require a blog list page displaying posts.
